qas.question: When did the Grand-Canyon mid-air collision happen?
when was the Federal Aviation Act passed?
What agency would now act like the CAA?
Who did the Federal Aviation Act transfer air safety regulation from?
Who was the FAA's first administrator?
Who did President Eisenhower appoint as the FAA's first administrator?
What prompted the the legislation act of 1956?
What legislation gave the CAAs function to the government body, the FAA?
Who was the former general to President Eisenhower?
The approaching era of air traffic control prompted passage of what act?

context: The approaching era of jet travel, and a series of midair collisions (most notable was the <a0_0><b6_0>1956<a0_0/> Grand Canyon mid-air collision<b6_0/>), prompted passage of the <b7_0><b9_0>Federal Aviation Act of <a1_0>1958<b9_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/>. This legislation gave the CAA's functions to a new independent body, the <a2_0>Federal Aviation Agency<a2_0/>. The act transferred air safety regulation from the <a3_0>CAB<a3_0/> to the new FAA, and also gave the FAA sole responsibility for a common civil-military system of air navigation and air traffic control. The FAA's first administrator, <a4_0><b5_0><b8_0>Elwood R. Quesada<b8_0/><b5_0/><a4_0/>, was a former Air Force general and adviser to President Eisenhower.
